title: `gz sdf -p model.sdf` prints the sdf description, not a file in the current folder

content.raw:
I was trying to print a model file in the current folder with `gz sdf -p model.sdf`, but I kept seeing errors like:

~~~
Error [parser_urdf.cc:3474] Unable to call parseURDF on robot model
Error [parser.cc:313] parse as old deprecated model file failed.
~~~

If I moved up to the parent folder, then I am able to print them properly with `gz sdf -p model_folder/model.sdf`.

The [gz sdf -p code](#!/osrf/gazebo/src/63bf55c324210f0ac2c12879953d4222fbf8aef5/tools/gz.cc?fileviewer=file-view-default#gz.cc-1050) first verifies that the path exists, then calls `sdf::readFile`, but it seems that `sdf::readFile` has its own logic when searching for file matches. So it's probably safer to read the file as a string and call `sdf::readString`.

This could be fixed in gazebo7 and merged forwards.

IssueForNewDevelopers
content.html:
I was trying to print a model file in the current folder with gz sdf -p model.sdf, but I kept seeing errors like:

Error [parser_urdf.cc:3474] Unable to call parseURDF on robot model
Error [parser.cc:313] parse as old deprecated model file failed.

If I moved up to the parent folder, then I am able to print them properly with gz sdf -p model_folder/model.sdf.

The gz sdf -p code first verifies that the path exists, then calls sdf::readFile, but it seems that sdf::readFile has its own logic when searching for file matches. So it's probably safer to read the file as a string and call sdf::readString.

This could be fixed in gazebo7 and merged forwards.
